Class Hand

java.lang.Object
model.Hand
public class Hand extends Object
Represents a hand of cards in the Blackjack game. A hand contains a collection of cards and methods for calculating its value, adding cards, and managing the hand's state.
Version:
1.0.0.
Author:
ptrzgal

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Hand()
    Constructs an empty hand of cards.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hand

      public Hand()
      Constructs an empty hand of cards.

  • Method Details

    • takeCardFromDeck

      public void takeCardFromDeck(Deck deck) throws Deck.EmptyDeckException
      Takes a card from the deck and adds it to the hand.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck from which to take the card
      Throws:
      Deck.EmptyDeckException - if the deck is empty and cannot provide a card

    • calculateValue

      public int calculateValue()
      Calculates and returns the total value of the cards in the hand. If the hand contains an Ace (value of 11), it will adjust the value if the total exceeds 21, converting some Aces to 1 until the value is 21 or less.
      Returns:
      the calculated value of the hand, considering any adjustments for Aces

    • discardHandToDeck

      public void discardHandToDeck(Deck discardDeck)
      Discards all the cards in the hand to the provided discard deck. After discarding, the hand is cleared.
      Parameters:
      discardDeck - the deck to which the cards from the hand will be discarded

    • getCard

      public Card getCard(int index)
      Gets the card at the specified index in the hand.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the card to retrieve
      Returns:
      the card at the specified index

    • getHandSize

      public int getHandSize()
      Returns the number of cards in the hand.
      Returns:
      the number of cards in the hand
